text: can we start blogging about this feature yet?
:zipper_mouth_face:  Take a peek at <https://app.HubSpotqa.com/l/design-manager/settings> and try, it _may_ work for you :zipper_mouth_face:
Not quite (please!)
no problem. Such an exciting feature! you guys deserve an award
<@U04DVL5T2TE> you mean the cms-dev-server?
Yes. But generally we’re going to recommend to update both `@HubSpot/cms-dev-server` and `@HubSpot/cms-components` together.
It's blocked for me :slightly_smiling_face:. But that's OK.
<@UCY83QS6Q> what version I will use for @HubSpot/cms-components?
Sorry, I should have been clearer. We keep those packages “version locked” and publish both at the same time with the same version. So `0.7.1` for both
Ow. Noted. Thank you!
Andrey, let’s talk :wink:
are there any plans to make projects standalone when deploying? right now I'm using an "external" `package.json` script to deploy which references an "external" `HubSpot.config.yml`
I guess technically I can just re-auth but not sure if I can have a nested script to deploy

hmm i’m not sure i follow the issue, maybe there’s some guidance that we’re missing on the CLI side for projects. what roughly is the `package.json` script that you’re running? theoretically you should be able to just `hs project upload` from within the project somewhere
there might be a requirement that the `HubSpot.config.yml` needs to be just in a parent directory to the project?
yea, it's the parent directory thing, but I'm testing now to see what happens in different scenarios
gotcha, and your script is pointing the command at a config file in a non-parent?
right now I have the `HubSpot.config.yml` in a parent folder
and just `hs project upload` is in a package.json file inside of a child folder
`cms-assets`
ah ok
currently the build is failing but not sure why yet / if my modified setup is relevant
yeah i wouldn’t expect the way the upload is called to affect the build success
same

does this seem relevant to you?
```--- global-nav-project failed with the following error ---
[ERROR] Building JS Project with error message `[vite]: Rollup failed to resolve import "@radix-ui/react-navigation-menu" from "/tmp/cms_W2sRKd/cms-js-build/customer-package/components/islands/GlobalNavIsland.jsx?client-entry".
This is most likely unintended because it can break your application at runtime.
If you do want to externalize this module explicitly add it to
`build.rollupOptions.external`
file:///tmp/cms_W2sRKd/cms-js-build/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-f7d05e3f.js:46547
                throw new Error(`[vite]: Rollup failed to resolve import "${exporter}" from "${id}".\n` +```
nope sounds like a separate issue. i can take a look
```import * as NavigationMenu from '@radix-ui/react-navigation-menu';```
this was working before...I copied and pasted the project into a separate folder
is this in a new project/portal? not seeing any recent builds/build failures
I'm building it on a sandbox site
but I can build in prod if that's easier
ah gotcha
no thats fine if you can just DM me the portal ID for that sandbox portal then i can check it out
sure thing
